# Diamond lane

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg) | This article **does not[cite](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources "Wikipedia:Citing sources") any [sources](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability "Wikipedia:Verifiability")**. Please help [improve this article](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Diamond_lane&action=edit) by [adding citations to reliable sources](/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1 "Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1"). Unsourced material may be challenged and [removed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability#Burden_of_evidence "Wikipedia:Verifiability"). _(October 2007)_ _([Learn how and when to remove this template message](/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal "Help:Maintenance template removal"))_  
---|---  
  
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/2a/Bike-diamond-
lane.jpg)](/wiki/File:Bike-diamond-lane.jpg)

A rider in a [bicycle](/wiki/Bicycle "Bicycle") diamond lane.

In the [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") and
[Canada](/wiki/Canada "Canada"), a **diamond lane** is a special
[lane](/wiki/Lane "Lane") on a [street](/wiki/Street "Street") or
[highway](/wiki/Highway "Highway") that is reserved for specific types of
[traffic](/wiki/Traffic "Traffic"). These lanes are usually marked with white
[diamonds](/wiki/Rhombus "Rhombus") or [lozenge](/wiki/Lozenge "Lozenge"),
hence their name. Diamond lanes are generally the right-most or left-most lane
on the road. They are usually implemented to provide ways through [traffic
congestion](/wiki/Traffic_congestion "Traffic congestion"), for safety
reasons, and to encourage environmentally friendly transportation. A diamond
lane may be intended for a specific type of traffic, or for several types. The
intended use of a diamond lane is marked by [traffic
signs](/wiki/Traffic_signs "Traffic signs"). In most areas, violating the
rules of a diamond lane is punishable by a [fine](/wiki/Fine_\(penalty\) "Fine
\(penalty\)").

Some common examples are:

  * [High-occupancy vehicle lane](/wiki/High-occupancy_vehicle_lane "High-occupancy vehicle lane") (HOV), also known as a carpool lane. These are typically [freeway](/wiki/Freeway "Freeway") lanes intended for multiple occupant or "[green vehicles](/wiki/Green_vehicle "Green vehicle")" (such as [hybrid](/wiki/Hybrid_vehicle "Hybrid vehicle") or [electric](/wiki/Electric_vehicle "Electric vehicle") cars).
  * [Bike lane](/wiki/Bike_lane "Bike lane"), sometimes referred to as [segregated cycle facilities](/wiki/Segregated_cycle_facilities "Segregated cycle facilities"). Separating bicycle traffic from [pedestrian](/wiki/Pedestrian "Pedestrian") or [motor vehicle](/wiki/Motor_vehicle "Motor vehicle") traffic is typically safer and improves [traffic flow](/wiki/Traffic_flow "Traffic flow").
  * [Bus lane](/wiki/Bus_lane "Bus lane"), an uncongested lane for buses to travel, load, or unload in.
  * [Emergency vehicle](/wiki/Emergency_vehicle "Emergency vehicle") lane, to help emergency vehicles get to their destination as fast as possible while avoiding traffic congestion.
  * [Taxicab](/wiki/Taxicab "Taxicab") lanes, most often found at [airports](/wiki/Airports "Airports") or other transit hubs for passenger loading and unloading.
  * [Horse and buggy](/wiki/Horse_and_buggy "Horse and buggy") lanes in areas with significant [Amish](/wiki/Amish "Amish") populations

## Standards[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Diamond_lane&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Standards")]

The [U.S. Department of
Transportation](/wiki/U.S._Department_of_Transportation "U.S. Department of
Transportation")'s [Manual on Uniform Traffic Control
Devices](/wiki/Manual_on_Uniform_Traffic_Control_Devices "Manual on Uniform
Traffic Control Devices") states that diamonds indicates a lane reserved for
high-occupancy vehicles. ["United States Pavement
Markings"](http://mutcd.fhwa.dot.gov/services/publications/fhwaop02090/).

## See also[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Diamond_lane&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: See also")]

  * [Reversible lane](/wiki/Reversible_lane "Reversible lane")
  * [High-occupancy toll](/wiki/High_occupancy/toll_and_express_toll_lanes "High occupancy/toll and express toll lanes")
  * [Local lane](/wiki/Local_lane "Local lane")
  * [Bike lane debate](/wiki/Bike_lane_debate "Bike lane debate")

qa.question: what does the white diamond road marking mean
qa.answer: ['a special lane on a street or highway that is reserved for specific types of traffic']
